business.headline: Prostarm Info Systems IPO listing: Will it make strong market debut? Check GMPThe listing of Prostarm Info Systems comes at a time when recent mainboard IPOs have not performed very well on debut. Bidding was open from May 27 to May 29, 2025, and saw a total subscription of 96.68 times.

Stocks to watch on June 3: ITC, HCLTech, Biocon, Prostarm Info SystemsThe markets had a shaky start to the week with the Sensex falling over 700 points in early trade, but later recovered to end flat.

Trade deal with India in not-too-distant future: US Commerce SecretaryA trade deal between India and the United States could be finalised soon, as negotiations gain momentum following reciprocal tariff tensions, with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick expressing optimism that both sides have found common ground.

Uber delivery chief steps down after 13 Years; Andrew Macdonald named COOAs senior vice president of Uber's delivery unit, Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty oversaw the company's Uber Eats business as well as grocery and other on-demand delivery offerings, and is credited with steering the division through the COVID-19 pandemic.

Adani faces US scrutiny over Iran LPG 'links', denies role, says unaware of probeGautam Adani's firms are under scrutiny from US prosecutors for reportedly importing Iranian LPG into India through Mundra port. A spokesperson denied the company's involvement and said it was not aware of such a probe.

Rs 1 crore in 5 years: Check this guide for 40-year-olds earning Rs 2.5 lakh/monthIf you're earning Rs 2.5 lakh a month, building a corpus of Rs 1 crore in just five years may sound ambitious, but it's certainly achievable with the right planning, discipline, and smart investments.
India likely to become a $30 trillion economy by 2047, says Amitabh KantAt present, India's economy is valued at around $4 trillion. It recently became the fourth largest economy in the world.

Tesla not ready to Make in India, says Union Minister: ReportThe Union Minister said that Tesla is not expected to begin manufacturing vehicles in India in the near future. He mentioned that the company is currently interested only in opening showrooms in the country.
Sensex closes 77 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Adani Ports gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 77.26 points to close at 81,373.75, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 34.10 points to end at 24,716.60.

EPFO extends UAN-Aadhaar linking deadline for ELI scheme to June 30. Check stepsAs per a recent circular issued by the EPFO, the new last date to activate your UAN and link your Aadhaar-linked bank account is June 30, 2025. This deadline has already been pushed back several times, giving employees extra time to complete the process.

Reliance Power shares surge 8% today, 23% in last week. Should you buy?Reliance Power share price: Over the last six months, it has gone up by 59.92%. The stock has more than doubled in a year with a 141.40% rise. Over the last five years, the rise has been massive; 2,602.61%.

Living paycheck to paycheck: Analyst says India has worst family financial planningAn analyst said that in 2025 we need to teach kids not just how to earn money but how to manage it. He pointed out a common but dangerous mindset, the one with no room for budgeting, risk awareness, or financial learning.

RBI MPC: 25 bps rate cut on the cards? Here's all you need to knowSo far in 2025, the RBI has already cut the repo rate twice, once in February and then in April, by 25 bps each time. These cuts brought the key lending rate down to 6%.

NPS pensioners to get more benefits under Unified Pension Scheme. Details hereEligible NPS retirees can either get a one-time payment based on their last drawn Basic Pay and Dearness Allowance (DA) for every six months of service, or receive a monthly top-up if their current pension is less than what they'd get under UPS with Dearness Relief.

Leela Hotels share price: Stock lists at 7% discount on Dalal StreetThe company's stock opened at Rs 406 on the NSE, which is Rs 29 below the issue price of Rs 435. On the BSE, it opened slightly higher at Rs 406.50, still lower by Rs 28.50, or about 6.55%.

Sensex tumbles 700 points. Why is stock market falling despite strong GDP growth?The BSE Sensex was down 732.71 points to 80,718.30 around 9:25 am, while the NSE Nifty50 traded 197.45 points lower at 24,553.25. Most of the broader market indices also fell sharply amid a surge in volatility.

Leela Hotels vs Aegis Vopak listing: Which IPO will make stronger market debut?Leela Hotels and Aegis Vopak had their initial public offerings (IPOs) open for subscription from May 26 to May 28. While both IPOs were fully subscribed, they did not see very high demand during the bidding period.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT, metal stocks drag market despite good GDP dataThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 723 points to 80,728.03, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 191 points to 24,559.95 as of 9:25 am.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty rally today after GDP numbers?India's economy grew by 7.4% in the January-March quarter, surprising many analysts. The growth was mainly driven by strong activity in the construction and manufacturing sectors.

Stocks to watch on June 2: IndiGo, Nykaa, Leela Hotels, Tata Motors, BPCLStocks such as Apollo Hospitals, IndiGo, Tata Motors, BPCL, Leela Hotels, and Aegis Vopak Terminals are expected to be in the spotlight, driven by recent news updates and their fourth-quarter earnings announcements.

Pankaj Tripathi joins Hyundai Motor India as brand ambassadorPankaj Tripathi is known for his roles in films and web series where he often plays characters that are relatable and grounded. Hyundai said this quality made him the right choice to represent the brand.

Air India in talks for another mega aircraft deal with Airbus, Boeing: SourcesThe plane orders come at a time when aircraft manufacturers are scrambling with supply chain issues leading to severe delays in aircraft delivery and a looming jet shortage.

Air India to move jet maintenance work from Turkey firm amid diplomatic tensionsAgainst the backdrop of Turkiye backing Pakistan and condemning India's strikes on terror camps in the neighbouring country in May, aviation security watchdog BCAS, on May 15, revoked the security clearance for Turkish company Celebi Airport Services India Pvt Ltd in the "interest of national security".

Fungus on food, expired goods: Zepto's Dharavi licence suspended over lapsesThe action against Zepto was taken after an inspection revealed fungal growth on food items, expired products, and unhygienic storage conditions.

IndiGo, Air France-KLM, Virgin Atlantic join hands to enhance travel to US, EuropeTo enhance air connectivity from India to Europe and North America, IndiGo, Delta Air Lines, Air France-KLM and Virgin Atlantic announced a partnership.

India orders IndiGo to end agreement with Turkish Airlines amid diplomatic tensionsThe Indian government has ordered IndiGo Airlines to terminate its damp lease agreement with Turkish Airlines by August 31. This decision comes in response to Turkey's continued support for Pakistan against India. The aviation regulator DGCA has granted a final three-month extension to the current lease, which was set to expire on May 31. IndiGo is currently operating two Boeing aircraft on damp lease from Turkish Airlines. The move is part of India's broader response to Turkey's actions, including supplying arms to Pakistan and condemning India's Operation Sindhu.

India reduces import tax on crude edible oils by 10% to bring down food pricesThe reduction in import tax will effectively bring down the total import duty on the three oils to 16.5 per cent from an earlier 27.5 per cent.

IndiGo to cut ties with Turkish Airlines amid row over Ankara's support to PakThe Directorate General of Civil Aviation said IndiGo gave an undertaking that it will terminate the lease with Turkish Airlines by August 31 and will not seek a further extension.

ITR-1 and ITR-4 Excel utilities out: Check who can file and what's new this yearExcel utilities for ITR-1 and ITR-4 are now available for AY 2025–26. Taxpayers can visit the income tax e-filing site to download and use them for filing returns for FY 2024–25.
Gensol misses May payment for loan on BluSmart cabs: ReportGensol Engineering reportedly missed a payment of about Rs 4 crore to its pass-through certificate (PTC) holders in May.
India's economic growth hits 4-year low of 6.5% in FY25The real GDP growth for the March quarter (Q4) stood at 7.4%, which is the fastest among all four quarters of the year.
Sensex closes 182 points lower, Nifty below 24,800; IT stocks drag marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 182 points to end at 81,451.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 82.90 points to close at 24,750.70.

From UPI withdrawals to online corrections: 5 expected features of EPFO 3.0EPFO's upcoming system aims to enhance financial flexibility for employees with features like instant UPI and ATM withdrawals, auto-claim settlements, and expanded withdrawal reasons.

Meet Leena Tewari, the USV chairperson who bought India's costliest flatsLeena is the chairperson of USV, a Mumbai-based pharmaceutical company, which was started by her late father, Vithal Gandhi, in partnership with Revlon in 1961. Forbes estimates Leena's net worth at $3.9 billion, as of May 30, 2025, making her one of India's richest women.

Explained: Why Arshad Warsi, wife Maria Goretti were banned by Sebi for 1 yearArshad Warsi and Maria Goretti bought shares of Sadhna Broadcast Limited (now known as Crystal Business System Ltd) from other individuals who were also named in the Sebi order.

How Trump's tariff tsunami is reshaping global economyIn just over four months, Trump's flurry of trade actions, alternating between shock-and-awe tariffs and strategic pauses, has upended conventional expectations.

Waiting for Form 16? Here's when will you get it and what to checkEmployers are required to issue Form 16 to employees if they've deducted TDS from their salary. It consists of two parts and shows how much salary was paid and how much tax was deducted during the year.

Arshad Warsi, his wife, among 59 people banned from stock market for 1 yearSebi said the group was part of a scheme to artificially raise the price of Sadhna Broadcast shares before selling them to unsuspecting retail investors.

Veteran investor explains why most investors fail in marketsAce investor Shankar Sharma said many investors fail to ask tough questions and instead rely on myths. He was critical of the belief that great investors can see into the future, dismissing it as an unrealistic myth.

India GDP data to be released today: What should investors expect?Earlier this year, the National Statistical Office had estimated that India's economy would grow by 6.5% in 2024–25, with an expected growth of 7.6% in the March quarter.

entertainment.headline: Healing to fitness: How Pankaj Tripathi's year-long break gave him newfound goalsActor Pankaj Tripathi took a quiet one-year break from films to focus on self-healing and fitness following his father's death. He also explained what prompted him to take this decision.

Ed Sheeran's Sapphire gets SRK touch, singer visits Arijit Singh, Baahubali setEd Sheeran and Shah Rukh Khan created one of the best moments on the Internet with a cute video of them singing the hookline of the singer's upcoming song, 'Sapphire'. Ed Sheeran also gave us a glimpse of his latest Indian tour.

Downton Abbey's last chapter: Trailer promises emotional goodbyeThe Crawleys return in Downton Abbey: The Grand Finale, set in 1930, reuniting beloved characters and introducing new ones. The film premieres September 12, closing the iconic saga with grace.

Disney lays off hundreds globally as part of ongoing restructuring planDisney has laid off several hundred employees globally across departments as part of CEO Bob Iger's restructuring plan to reduce costs and pivot towards streaming, continuing efforts to optimize operations and boost profitability.

Jonathan Joss, 'King of the Hill' actor, fatally shot by neighbor in San AntonioActor Jonathan Joss, known for King of the Hill, was fatally shot by a neighbor during an argument in San Antonio. The suspect was arrested and charged with murder. Investigation is ongoing.

RGV criticises backlash against Kamal Haasan's Thug Life, deletes tweet laterFilmmaker Ram Gopal Varma deleted his post where he supported actor Kamal Haasan amid threats to ban 'Thug Life' in Karnataka. Varma questioned democracy over rising intolerance.

Rapper Cardi B confirms relationship with footballer Stefon Diggs, ex Offset reactsAmerican rapper Cardi B's ex-husband Offset subtly reacted to her public romance with NFL star Stefon Diggs. The singer-rapper later deleted his cryptic post.

Fans praise Ishaan Khatter as he grooves to BTS' MIC DropActor Ishaan Khatter shared a clip from his Miss World 2025 performance where he performed on BTS' MIC Drop. Fans compared his dance moves to American singer-musician Bruno Mars.

Rekha's cult classic Umrao Jaan set to return to theatresBollywood classic 'Umrao Jaan', starring Rekha, is returning to theatres on June 27 in a newly restored 4K version. The re-release is accompanied by a special coffee table book offering rare behind-the-scenes insights.

Sonali Bendre on disappointment with Duplicate: Grey role became one-dimensionalActor Sonali Bendre shared her disappointment with her role in 'Duplicate', saying it turned out to be very one-dimensional. She also recalled fun memories with Salman Khan during 'Hum Saath Saath Hain' and spoke about the struggles of shooting in heavy costumes.

Dhanush confirms Vada Chennai 2 filming to begin next yearAfter years of speculation and fan anticipation, Dhanush has officially announced the sequel to his acclaimed gangster drama 'Vada Chennai'. The project will reunite him with director Vetrimaaran, with production to start next year.

Bhool Chuk Maaf OTT release: When and where to watch Rajkummar-Wamiqa starrer filmRajkummar Rao and Wamiqa Gabbi's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' will premiere on Prime Video on June 6, just two weeks after its theatrical release. Originally planned for a direct OTT debut, the film hit cinemas on May 23.

Actor Sooraj Pancholi says Bollywood is caught in a vicious cycleActor Sooraj Pancholi spoke about Bollywood's vicious cycle and self-destruction. He urged kindness and unity to save the industry from further downfall.

Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday tease youthful romance in Tu Meri Main…first lookKartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday hinted at a youthful love story in the first look poster from their upcoming film, 'Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri'. The film is slated to hit the screens in February 2026.

Anushka Shetty's Ghaati to release in theatres in July 2025, new poster outAfter facing multiple delays, 'Ghaati', the much-awaited action-crime drama starring actor Anushka Shetty is set for a release on July 11.

Cinematographer Pratik to exit Ganguly biopic amid sexual misconduct row: ReportCinematographer Pratik Shah, who has been accused of sexual harassment based on testimonies of multiple women, is likely to be dropped from the Sourav Ganguly biopic, suggested reports.

BTS countdown 2025: Discharge dates, comeback clues, OT7 reunion buzzBTS begins their reunion as members complete military service this June. A comeback is expected soon, with 2025 full-group plans underway. Their FESTA skit revealed the theme Twelve O'Clock, symbolising new beginnings for ARMY.

Shabana Azmi shares adorable throwback with betu Farhan AkhtarVeteran actor Shabana Azmi shared a heartwarming throwback photo with Farhan Akhtar. The photo was from Farhan's wedding with Shibani Dandekar in 2022.

Neeraj Ghaywan shares Homebound was inspired by powerful pandemic-era true storyDirector Neeraj Ghaywan shared a series of posts on X and revealed that his film 'Homebound' is inspired by a powerful pandemic-era true story. He even thanked the entire team for their efforts behind the film.

general news.headline: Trade deal with India in not-too-distant future: US Commerce SecretaryA trade deal between India and the United States could be finalised soon, as negotiations gain momentum following reciprocal tariff tensions, with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick expressing optimism that both sides have found common ground.

In Spain, Kanimozhi's 'diversity' reply to India's national language questionKanimozhi was questioned by the members of the Indian Diaspora on the National Language of India, to which she replied, 'Unity in Diversity'.

Man who filed case against Sharmistha Panoli missing, claims his fatherWajahat Khan, the complainant in the case that led to Panoli's arrest, has reportedly gone missing. His father, Saadat Khan, in an interview with Aaj Tak, India Today's sister channel, claimed that his son had not been seen since Sunday night.

IPL 2025 final, RCB vs PBKS: 17-year wait, 18th attempt, one dreamIPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS: A new IPL champion will be crowned on Tuesday, June 3, as Royal Challengers Bengaluru clash against Punjab Kings. Rajat Patidar and Shreyas may be the captains, but the focus will be on Virat Kohli.

Modi, mangoes and puppets: Usha Vance on her children's first India experienceUsha Vance, Second Lady of the United States, shared touching memories of her family's India visit. She recounted her children's delightful encounter with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

News Menu, May 3: PM's vital cabinet meet today after Op Sindoor; IPL finalPM Modi will hold a key Cabinet meeting today, the first since the Pahalgam attack, and the IPL final is also scheduled for today, all this and more in India Today's spicy news menu.

Putin thought time was on his side, Ukraine proved him wrong: Ian BremmerIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, geopolitical expert Ian Bremmer said that Russia's Vladimir Putin had been unwilling to take any meaningful steps that would bring him to the table for a peace deal with Ukraine.

Government to launch portal for registration of Waqf properties on June 6The portal, which stands for 'Unified Waqf Management, Empowerment, Efficiency, and Development', will serve as a centralised platform for registering Waqf properties nationwide, sources said.

How Zelenskyy's spiders spit fire on Russia — a 360 view from Earth and skyOperation Spider's Web, Ukraine's Sunday assault on Russia, has been hailed worldwide as a grand espionage success story. Here's how it unfolded at the five target locations.

Colorado firebomb suspect spent a year planning attack on pro-Israel groupAccording to court documents, Mohamed Sabry Soliman told investigators that he wanted to 'kill all Zionist people' but postponed the attack until his daughter graduated from high school. He also said he learned how to make bombs by watching YouTube videos.

Unstoppable Jannik Sinner into quarters, inspired Bublik stuns Jack DraperFrench Open 2025: Jannik Sinner secured a commanding straight-sets win over Andrey Rublev to reach his third Roland Garros quarterfinals. Alexander Bublik caused an upset by defeating Jack Draper in four sets on Monday.

Tharoor and Bhutto-led teams head to US for India-Pakistan diplomatic faceoffAn Indian delegation led by Shashi Tharoor is visiting the US to explain India's stand after Operation Sindoor. Meanwhile, Pakistan's Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari is leading a team to present Islamabad's view, as both nations seek support from US leaders.

Healing to fitness: How Pankaj Tripathi's year-long break gave him newfound goalsActor Pankaj Tripathi took a quiet one-year break from films to focus on self-healing and fitness following his father's death. He also explained what prompted him to take this decision.

Donald Trump and Xi Jinping will speak this week to ease trade tensionsDonald Trump and Chinese leader Xi Jinping are expected to speak this week to ease ongoing trade tensions. The call aims to address tariff disputes and improve relations after a recent temporary truce slowed progress between the two countries.

Ajay Devgn, Kajol and mansplaining in full view: It wasn't his question to answerIn the full view of the media, actor Ajay Devgn answered a question which was addressed to Kajol, at the trailer launch of 'Maa'. Here's just saying that when a woman is asked about her experience, let her speak. Don't take the mic, or her moment!

Anti-Hasina warriors get tax relief like 1971 freedom fightersBangladesh's interim government of Muhammad Yunus has granted personal tax exemption for income of up to 5.25 lakh taka to wounded 'July Warriors' — the protesters who took part in the agitation against Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. The war-wounded freedom fighters of the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War will also get a similar tax exemption.

Why Gen-Z and millennials can't stop buying toys, plushies? Kidulting explainedAre you 30-something and excited to buy the latest Avengers collectable? No, it is not being childish but just being a kidult.

Is India a weak country or can it stand up to Trump? What Ian Bremmer saidDespite being the world's most populous nation, the fourth-largest economy, and a nuclear power, India finds itself in a tricky position when engaging with a leader like Trump, who pressures allies with tariffs and threats, geopolitical analyst Ian Bremmer noted.

Calm after the storm, Magnus Carlsen praises Gukesh's fighting skillsMagnus Carlsen acknowledged D Gukesh's energy and fighting qualities after his shock loss to the world champion in Round 6 of Norway Chess 2025.

Leaks from Indian lab drop bombshell on boxer Imane Khelif's biological sexLeaked lab documents claim Algerian boxer Imane Khelif is biologically male. A 2023 Indian test reportedly found XY chromosomes, but Olympic officials dismissed the results, citing possible Russian interference. Khelif denies the claims.

Ed Sheeran's Sapphire gets SRK touch, singer visits Arijit Singh, Baahubali setEd Sheeran and Shah Rukh Khan created one of the best moments on the Internet with a cute video of them singing the hookline of the singer's upcoming song, 'Sapphire'. Ed Sheeran also gave us a glimpse of his latest Indian tour.

Jagan Reddy accuses Chandrababu Naidu of leading Andhra Pradesh to 'debt trap'A political showdown erupts in Andhra Pradesh with Jagan Reddy accusing Chandrababu Naidu of reckless borrowing. Naidu, however, has blamed the previous government for bad fiscal decisions during its tenure.

India not starting a war, just retaliating for terror: Shashi TharoorShashi Tharoor clarified that India's Operation Sindoor is a calculated response to the Pahalgam terror attack, not an act of war, but retribution against those aiming to destabilise Kashmir.

Locals perform puja for transformer's long life amid outages in Madhya PradeshThe residents of Gandhi Nagar area in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind performed a special puja for a newly-installed transformer, distributed sweets amongst themselves and prayed for its longevity.

sports.headline: Toss crucial in IPL final? Gavaskar opens up on rainy weather in AhmedabadIPL 2025 Final: In an exclusive interview with India Today, former batter Sunil Gavaskar said that toss could end up playing a big factor since there are chances of rain during the summit clash in Ahmedabad.

18 for No. 18? Why Virat Kohli deserves to lift the IPL trophyVirat Kohli's IPL journey has been one of brilliance shadowed by heartbreak, but this season, with a balanced and battle-hardened RCB squad, the elusive crown finally feels within reach. After 18 years of near-misses, fate seems poised to hand the icon the crown he's long deserved.

Punjab Kings at a disadvantage? Gavaskar weighs in before finalIPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS: Sunil Gavaskar said that Punjab Kings are at a slight disadvantage since they haven't had much time for recovery before the all-important final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

RCB vs PBKS Live: Shreyas, Rajat ready to guide league into a new eraRCB (Bengaluru) vs PBKS (Punjab), IPL 2025 Final Live Score and Updates from Ahmedabad: Shreyas Iyer's Punjab Kings and Rajat Patidar's Royal Challengers Bengaluru meet in the final of the Indian Premier League 2025. A new champion is set to be crowned as these two teams collide at the Narendra Modi Stadium on Tuesday.

Captain Marvel: Shreyas Iyer a win away from his moment in the sunIPL 2025 Final: Shreyas Iyer led Kolkata Knight Riders to an IPL title last season, but the spotlight never quite found him. Now with Punjab Kings, he's just one win away from carving out a legacy of his own—taking PBKS to their first-ever IPL crown. This is more than just a trophy chase; it's Shreyas's moment to command the respect and recognition he's been chasing all along.

IPL 2025 final, RCB vs PBKS: 17-year wait, 18th attempt, one dreamIPL 2025 Final, RCB vs PBKS: A new IPL champion will be crowned on Tuesday, June 3, as Royal Challengers Bengaluru clash against Punjab Kings. Rajat Patidar and Shreyas may be the captains, but the focus will be on Virat Kohli.

Unstoppable Jannik Sinner into quarters, inspired Bublik stuns Jack DraperFrench Open 2025: Jannik Sinner secured a commanding straight-sets win over Andrey Rublev to reach his third Roland Garros quarterfinals. Alexander Bublik caused an upset by defeating Jack Draper in four sets on Monday.

Calm after the storm, Magnus Carlsen praises Gukesh's fighting skillsMagnus Carlsen acknowledged D Gukesh's energy and fighting qualities after his shock loss to the world champion in Round 6 of Norway Chess 2025.

IPL final predicted XI, team news: Will RCB get Tim David boost?IPL 2025 final, RCB vs PBKS: Royal Challengers Bengaluru will hope to have their big-hitting finisher TIm David back for the big clash. Yuzvendra Chahal, meanwhile, is a doubtful starter for Punjab Kings due to a wrist injury.

Pro-Kohli crowd in IPL final: PBKS coach ready for tough battle in AhmedabadPunjab's fast-bowling coach James Hopes said his team would be "recovering and getting mentally prepared" for what he expects will be "a pretty big crowd, and a pretty big pro-Kohli crowd as well, in the IPL 2025 final in Ahmedabad."

India A batters shine, bowlers struggle vs England Lions in drawn unofficial TestAfter the England Lions posted 587 in reply to India A's 557, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Abhimanyu Easwaran, Dhruv Jurel and Nitish Kumar Reddy made the most of batting-friendly conditions with fluent half-centuries, gaining valuable confidence ahead of the second unofficial Test in Northampton on June 6.

Unstoppable Jannik Sinner into quarters, inspired Bublik stuns Jack DraperFrench Open 2025: Jannik Sinner secured a commanding straight-sets win over Andrey Rublev to reach his third Roland Garros quarterfinals. Alexander Bublik caused an upset by defeating Jack Draper in four sets on Monday.

Calm after the storm, Magnus Carlsen praises Gukesh's fighting skillsMagnus Carlsen acknowledged D Gukesh's energy and fighting qualities after his shock loss to the world champion in Round 6 of Norway Chess 2025.

IPL final predicted XI, team news: Will RCB get Tim David boost?IPL 2025 final, RCB vs PBKS: Royal Challengers Bengaluru will hope to have their big-hitting finisher TIm David back for the big clash. Yuzvendra Chahal, meanwhile, is a doubtful starter for Punjab Kings due to a wrist injury.

Pro-Kohli crowd in IPL final: PBKS coach ready for tough battle in AhmedabadPunjab's fast-bowling coach James Hopes said his team would be "recovering and getting mentally prepared" for what he expects will be "a pretty big crowd, and a pretty big pro-Kohli crowd as well, in the IPL 2025 final in Ahmedabad."

India A batters shine, bowlers struggle vs England Lions in drawn unofficial TestAfter the England Lions posted 587 in reply to India A's 557, Yashasvi Jaiswal, Abhimanyu Easwaran, Dhruv Jurel and Nitish Kumar Reddy made the most of batting-friendly conditions with fluent half-centuries, gaining valuable confidence ahead of the second unofficial Test in Northampton on June 6.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
